attributes.action: Allow voters to vote themselves, by internet, on issues that interest them
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the past we needed MPs to represent us in parliament. Now, internet technology has made it possible for each member of the electorate to represent himself / herself. 

Each voter should elect his MP, by intenet, and change his MP at any time, by internet (doing away with the need for General Elections).

Each MP should be able to cast not one vote but a number of votes equal to the number of voters that he represents less the number ´his /her´ voters that have chosen to vote for themselves (on a particular issue).

Most voters would choose, most of the time, not to vote directly but to let their MP cast their vote for them. Shortly before a vote is taken the MP should declare (on his web-site) how he intends to vote and why. Voters need only to vote for themselves if they disagree with their MPs decision.
